WorkItem.Description:
An easy optimization TypeScript could make is to join static strings together at compile time, rather than leaving this operation to the runtime. Common Example: var myDiv = "
" + "

" + "Hello world" + "

" + "
"; Should be compile down to: "

Hello world

"
WorkItem.Summary: Joining strings defined at compile time

Comments.Message: It's somewhat unlikely that TypeScript will support exactly what's described here in the near term.  That said, code like this is most common when breaking a large string across lines, and once TypeScript supports "string interpolation"/"template strings" ([item #19](http://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/19)), this scenario will be accomplished more directly.
